intro: Trichodesma zeylanicum var. commune, commonly known as Indian borage, is a flowering plant native to southern Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its blue or violet flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments and has opposite, ovate leaves. It is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. The botanical features of this species make it an important plant in both ecological and traditional medicinal contexts.
